comments.author: Nutelko8

comments.text:
Things like this make me look forward to living the future. So many awesome 
things happened during my lifetime that people wouldn't have believed to be 
possible a scant few decades ago. And yet there is so much left to be seen, 
so much we just barely started mapping out.

Sometimes I imagine people looking back at these past years as a start of 
something truly great, and I am content.

It is good to be human.﻿

comments.text:
Why didn't they show Jenni Rivera when they passed those people who passed 
away in 2012. This proves that is Latinos are invisible to the United 
States. And many people will day, OH she wasn't American, well she was a 
Mexican American singer who helped and still helps through her foundation 
many children with illnesses. Her foundation called Jenni Rivera Love 
Foundation helps single and abused women and children find homes and 
support. They should of also remembered her because her death was the most 
hectic one. Her plane crashed after giving her last concert. She was flying 
to go film the show called The Voice Mexico. Her plane crashed more than 
25,000 ft, only 7 minutes after take off. She left 5 children behind. She 
was about to star in her own comic sitcom on ABC. You guys don't know what 
great potential she had to offer. Its a shame that sometimes people have 
tongue to get their great heart and life recognized.﻿

comments.text:
I think what makes this zeitgeist different, and better, than the 2013 and 
2014 videos is that it is longer. It's able to cover more. And when you are 
covering 365 days, I don't think shorter is better. Nonetheless, I love 
looking back on the years. I do think 2014 has been the most... Depressing. 
Lots of tragedy. So here is to a great 2015! :)﻿
